text: bottled on 25 september 2014, sehr dunkler braun, brauner feiner schaum, leicht rauchig süsslich in der nase, rund um voll im antrunk, leichte süße (aber nicht malzig süss), leicht rauchig im abgang, leichte schärfe im nachgang

Aromat zdominowany jest papryką, świeżą i chilli. W tle nuty kawy i subtelna czekolada.
W smaku pełne, czekoladowe, również z dominującą świeżą papryką. Goryczka średnio-niska kakaowa, finisz to pieczenie chilli, ale ujarzmione i przyjemne. Dymu i wędzonki brak.
Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupełniania profilu na ratebeer. Solidny RIS, fajniutki syrop klonowy i czekolada, kawa.

Bottle @home. Pours black with a tan head. Nose is just smoke for me, way too much smoke at that. Taste is big smoke, some licorice, chocolate and just a tad of smoked bacon because this beer needed more smoke.

Piwo klarowne w czarnym kolorze z bezowa pian ana grobosc jednego palca. W aromacie palone ciemne slody, troche wedzonki i czekolady. W smaku raczej slodkie, jest gorzka czekolada, troche kawy i minimalna ostrosc od papryczek. Goryczka i wysycenie na srednim poziomie.

Draught @ Fermentoren, Halmtorvet 29 c, Copenhagen, Denmark 1700. [ As Buxton / Arizona Wilderness Dragon Tips ].Clear dark black brown color with a average to large, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, light beige head. Aroma is moderate to heavy malty, roasted, oat, dark malt, sweet malt, light smoke - maple - earthy (chili fruit). Flavor is moderate to heavy sweet and bitter with a long duration, dark malt, chocoalte, sweet malt - maple, light smoke - earthy (chili fruit), smoke - meat - bacon notes. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. [20160511]

Draft @ Fermentoren, Copenhagen. Pours a black color with a small tan head. Has a roasted malty chocolate and weak chili aroma. Roasted malty weak smoky chocolate flavor. Has a roasted malty weak smoky chocolate finish.

On tap at Fermentoren. Black with brown head. Aroma of roasted malt, coffee, dark chocolate, cocoa, light smoke and faint chilies. Taste is medium sweet, roasty, chocolate, coffee, smoke, faint chili, light lingering chili heat and slight alcohol. Nice one

Tap @ Fermentoren CPH. Almost black with small beige head. Aroma is roasted malts, chocolate, smoke, meat, coffee, hop and liquorice. Flavour is roasted malts, chocolate, smoke, meat, coffee, liquorice, medium sweet and medium bitter.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Takeover, Fermentoren, Copenhagen (10/05/2016) - pours black with a tan head. Dark roasted malty aroma and taste, with chocolate, some coffee, caramel, some nice burnt malty and spicy notes going on, roasted finish.

Draught @ Fermentoren, Copenhagen. Pours black with a creamy light brown head, lacings. Aroma of roasted malt, coffee, dark chocolate, cocoa, little smoke, light chilli. Flavor is light sweet, rich malty, coffee, bitter dark chocolate, light smoke, light chilli. Medium to full body, oily mouthfeel, soft carbonation, warming alcohol in the finish. 120516

Draft at Fermentoren. Black with a medium beige head. Aroma of roast, overripe dark fruits, licorice, caramel, toffee, dark chocolate. Flavour is light heavy sweet and moderate bitter. Full bodied with soft carbonation.

UPDATED: MAY 12, 2016 Tap @Fermentoren, Cph. Pours deep opaque black with a large, staying creamy beige head. Aroma has sweet malts, smoke, chocolate, coffee, oak, vanilla. Medium to low carbonation, fine dry and quite creamy mouthfeel. Flavour has good malty sweetness, roasted, light smoke, oak, sweet sugars. Lingering malty bitterness.

Tap @ Fermentoren, Copenhagen. Black with a light brown head. Aroma is sweet, roasted malt, light vanilla and lots of chocolate. Flavor is quite sweet and rather bitter. Dry and rather bitter finish. Oily. 120516

Tap at Fermentoren. Poured a murky dark brown with a frothy light tan head. The aroma is sweet liqourice malt. The flavour is moderate sweet light bitter with a crisp, light sweet malt, light spice, hop bitter palate. Medium bodied with average carbonation.
From tap at Fermentoren black with an beige head. Aroma and flavour of roasted malt, coffee, chocolate, caramel, bitterness, berries and hops.
From tap. Pours hazy dark brown to black. Roasted malty. Chocolate and dry and bitter. Lingering roasted nalty, dark chocolate. Lingering dark malty, mild meaty. Roasted and dense malty finish.
Draft. A black beer with a lazing brown head. The aroma has notes of roasted malt, smoke, and chocolate. The aroma has notes roasted malt, chocolate, and a bit of smoke, leading to a roasted finish.

Bottle. Pours black. Aroma of roasted malts, smoke, coffee and chocolate. Taste is sweet with a touch of bitter. The chilli is noticeable, creates a nice mouth warming feel. If anything could have taken a touch more. Couldnt really taste the bacon.

red brown pour some tan head. Aroma char, chilis, wood. flavor char blends with chili. soy bittersweet chocolate cake big spice through the mid. lingering hit of charred pork. Greatttt though bacon is not all that present.

12oz bottle from Prairie Trail Hy-Vee, in a Sam Smith pint glass. Subdued aroma of roasted malt, chocolate chips and baking chocolate with hints of crispy bacon smoke and brown sugar. Pours oily black with half a finger of bubbly light brown head that dissipates rapidly to a foamy ring. Delicate effervescence clinging to the glass. Powerful medium roast coffee flavor up front followed by dark roast coffee, dark chocolate, and wood smoke with a gentle alcoholic burn on the finish. Easy to drink. Has me craving something salty. Full bodied and creamy with good carbonation, astringent like a strong cup of coffee. Very good. An excellent stout with good balance and a little more going on in terms of flavor and aroma than the garden variety stout. Not entirely what I was hoping for from a beer that proudly announces maple bacon chipotle on the front label, but still a very good beer.
Drank with Marijn at my place before dinner, after which we headed to Malden for a special night 11-2-2016. Nice beer. Chili is noticable. Bacon is hidden. But a fine beer with good taste.

.33l bottle @ Hannikus Cave. (bottled 09/2014) Pours black with medium tan head. Aroma is dark malts, coffee, liquorice, chipotle, dark fruits, syrup, ash tray. Dryish. Well hidden alcohol. Flavor is mostly same with chili and bacon notes. Nice beer!

UPDATED: NOV 24, 2016 Bottled sept 25, 2014. Best before sept 25, 2016. Color is black with a dark brown head. Aroma of bacon, syrup, and slight chilli. Bacon and chili taste with a syrup aftertaste. Not a fan of bacon flavor, but solid beer.

Bottle at home, 16th January 16. Pours black, aroma is sweet, some hint of chilli, chocolate, maybe maple. Taste is sweet, very subtle chilli, but works to temper the sweetness of the maple and stout, slight bitterness. Nice, could have had more chilli
Smell is malty roasty stout with a bit of chili. Taste is the same with a hint of the maple, but I dont get any bacon. Medium to full body with low carbonation and no foam.
sweet malty toasted aroma,black, brown foam, medium sweetness, lightly bitter, medium body, creamy, nice harmonic finish.
Smokey aromas, and a dark black colour. creamy mouthfeel, and enough of the chilli to cut through the sweetness .

Bottle shared with wihorock. Poured a dark brown color with an average frothy tan head that mostly lasted with good lacing. Moderate to heavy roasted chocolate malt and smoked bacon aroma. Medium to full body with a smooth texture and flat carbonation. Medium to heavy toasted malt smoke sweet flavor with a medium to heavy dark sweet and small alcohol bite finish of moderate to long duration. This is solid beer.

Bottle. Pours black with a thick dense tan head. Aroma of coffee, soft chocolate, smoke and had a hint of bacon. Flavor of chocolate, coffee, ash, roasted malts, faint smoke, bacon, subtle chili and a touch of maple.
Draft sample. Dark brown color, medium beige head. Aroma of burnt toast, toffee, cocoa. Taste has burnt sweetened espresso, dark bitter chocolate, very light pepper heat. Nice.

UPDATED: OCT 14, 2015 33cl bottle. black pour. Very savory beer form the bacon, not much spice, pleasant but not mindblowing, not extremely smoky but it is there firmly. Looks like brittons find black pepper to be hot chili spice.
Bottle thanks to Toby. Pours out black topped with a tan head. Nose is roast malts chili coffee vanilla cocoa. Taste is more of the rich malts chili plenty roast malts cocoa.

Bottle take out grove inn huddersfield. Black good tan head. Aroma is roasty dark malts treacle. Taste coffee nice smokey chilli slight sweetness some bacon good roasty malts subtle chilli heat in the finish nice bitter finish. Decent mouthfeel prickly carbonation. Good stuff.
Dark brown coloured. Has an off-white head,lasting. Roasted aroma, Flavor starts heavy sweet, complex and still harmonic, faint smoke, vanilla, faint hot chili, spicy. No bacon ;o)
Bottle. Black colour with medium creamy light brown mostly lasting head. Aroma is roasted malt. Very spicy flavor. Creamy palate .

Bottle. Creamy lightbrown good mostly head. Black colour. Heavy malty and moderate hoppy arom. Heavy bitter wonderfull flavor. Roast, coffee and chocolate. Long heavy bitter finish. Creamy palate. Nice.
Smokey aroma in a jet black pour. Taste is full on smokey bacon to start with a smooth maple syrup body to balance and a dry finish to end.
Mild aroma of chocolate, taste is much more powerful chocolate with lots of maple syrup and hints of smoked bacon, very nice

Bottle from Berkeley Bowl West. Pours very dark brn with a dark tan head. Aroma of bacon and chili, and something like brown sugar. Near full bodied. Flavor is chocolate, bacon, chili, and something sweet. Its rather earthy, and well towards dry. Sort of chili/bacon/chocolate - suggesting one of those Portland bacon bars.

A very interesting, unique beer. Pours a slightly watery black with no head. Smells of maple syrup, vanilla, s'mores, with a bit of chili, cinnamon, smokiness and doughnut. The chili peppers and bacon smokiness are brought out more in the taste. Lots of spiciness, with a finish of chocolate and bacon. Had in the bottle.
Bottle at home dark almost black colour aroma is smokey some mollasas flavour is sweet maple smokey hint of bacon and slight chilli heat smooth sweet finish

Touch of smoke, light black pepper, molasses, bell pepper, very faintly piquant, deep dark roast, medium to medium full body, medium aroma volume, some wet oxidative notes, might be hop related. Very dark in appearance, slightly resinous surface. Heat may also be a touch of alcohol. Altogether nicely cohesive and well done.

330 ml. bottled 25/9/14 thats labeled 8.9%. It seemed like the bottle smelled like bacon before I even cracked the lid. Pours opaque jet with a thin creamy film on top. Aroma is espresso, dark chocolate, soured ham, dark toast and smoke. Front flavors of bacon, espresso and dark chocolate gives way to deep caramel and whole grain toast. Long finish is a nice mix of beef, soy, brown sugar, oats and dry cocoa. Medium-heavy body is smooth with medium carbonation and has a nice balance for such a rich beer.

Shared 11.2 oz. bottle poured to snifters, displaying a black/brown hue, with some ruby highlighting, fluffy, tan head foam, and dots & dashes of clingy lacing. The nose was roasted, a bit burnt, with cocoa, a touch of coffee on the back, and a light, meaty hint of maple cured bacon. The taste was similar, with a medium body, soft carbonation, a touch of silkiness to the mouthfeel, somewhat hidden alcohol, and a lingering, earthy & peppery bitterness that seemed a bit too intense for balance. Otherwise, pretty tasty.

11.2 ounce bottle, bottled 25/9/14, best before 25/9/16. Served in a snifter, the beer pours dark brown/black with about an inch tan head. Head retention and lacing are both good. The brew smells like roasted malt, coffee, chocolate and some chili peppers. The taste is mostly just like the aroma, but theres the addition of some maple and smoked malt/meats. However, those flavors arent strong at all. Dont get me wrong, its a tasty brew. But the maple and bacon/smoked meat flavors are subtle, and the chili pepper flavor is just a little stronger in comparison. Mouthfeel/body is medium, its creamy and coating with a good amount of carbonation. Overall I thought it was a good stout, and its definitely worth trying. Just dont expect a lot of maple, chili and bacon flavor out of it. If you look at this brew as being a good imperial stout (and dont pay attention to the maple, chili and bacon on the label), then youll like it as much as I did. $7.99 a bottle.

Black with a big head that ends in an island. Complete lacing. Aroma of bacon and deep burned malt. Taste of sweet chocolate, treacle and coffee. The chilly comes in the aftertaste. A bottle is actually to much taste.
Pours a black color with a roasted malt and maple syrup aroma. Taste is chili, chocolate malt, with some minor bitterness in the aftertaste. A thinner beer than I expected but decent.

Bottle from Ol Beercafe. Poursvdark brown with a thick tan head snd a maple chocolate aroma. There is a huge smoky bacon and treacle flavor with a hint of maple and a dry bitter finish with a little heat. Complex and tasty.

schenkt zwart met schuimige bruine kraag. aroma van mout, zoet, chocolade en koffie. smaken zijn redelijk zoet, matig bitter, sterk, matig fruitig, redelijk gebrande mouten , chocolade, pittig karakter van de chili is zeker merkbaar, cacao, licht poederachtig droog, mocco, koffie, redelijke body, romig met lage co2 bittertje blijft lang aanwezig

Bottle. Black with a quickly dissipating mocha head. Aroma is fudge, bacon and maple. Chili comes out a lot in the taste with a smoky bacon finish. Mouthfeel is thinner than I expected. All in all pretty solid.

With Z, pours a thick rich black color with a Java head. Nose is very rich and deep chocolate and malt. Taste is sweet rich chocolate with smoke and some mild  tamed  chilli. Finish is sweet and ends on the same tasting notes, quite satisfying and delicious. Quaff Score 8 / 10

Bottle. Pours black with a brown head and aroma of chocolate, roasted malt, and peppers. Taste is smokey, with chilli and pepper notes, along with chocolate, roasted malt and some sweet syrup jets leading to a smokey finish.

Bottle 0,33. Gift from D. Shared with friends.
Interesting version of imperial stout. Bacon flavour and taste in addition to multi-layer complex experience. Good. Someday shall try it again.

33cl bottle from the brewery shop. It pours a dark brown color with a small beige head. Aroma is rich toasted coffee, roasted malts, cocoa, smoke and light vegetable notes. Taste is lightly bitter and sweet with some light burning in the finish. Notes of cocoa, espresso, wood, roasted malts, green pepper. Full body with silky mouthfeel and good carbonation. Overall, good imperial stout though was expecting something more
Aroma is of smoke and chili skins as well as coffee. Taste is of chili skins, coffee, and some smoke.
Small format. Bottle split with the wife. Pours the part. Light smokeyness, chocolate. Medium body with lingering smoke.

Very dark brown pour, brown head. Lightly smokey, not much bacon, some chocolate, good roasted malt bill and maybe a hint of maple as it got to room temp. Pretty nice overall. I bet the barrel aged version is really nice.

Bottle with Dirtman at The Newly refurbished New Penguin, 19/02/15. Deep mahogany draped with lace beneath a slim beige top. Full juicy blueberry, assorted other berries, mellow Frazzles, molten plastic notes. Nose mellow bacon, swimming pool water, dried berries. Underwhelming although thoroughly decent.
just a sweet smoky stout, thin and a little boring. Wasnt really getting into it, nothing great but nothing wrong.

Poured a deep black color with aromas of roast, maple syrup, choclate, light peppers and some earth. Flavors match the aromas with some light smokiness to it and salt. Little bit bacon flavor comes through but not overpowerong solid overall.

11.2 oz. bottle from The Party Source. Pours dark brown to black in color with a medium sized tan head. The aroma and flavor have nice roasted malts, a splash of coffee, hints of sweet maple syrup, another splash of smoky bacon, dark chocolate, some earthy bitterness and the right amount of peppery kick. I thought this was pretty solid.

330ml bottle. Pours opaque with beige head. Was dreading this as theres nothing I hate more than chili in beer. Apart from garlic. Thankfully there was just a teasing hint of chili to this, no discernible bacon. A night roasted Imperial Stout with the slightest fiery kick.
Aroma is dark malts, spices and a hint of heat. The flavor is dark malts, slightly greasy/bacon, mild syrup notes and a mild heat in the finish.
18 May 2015, bottle. black. nose is acidic and roasted malt. thin body and moderately fizzy. very roasty and burnt malt. acidic and burnt thats all.

11.2oz bottle from Craftshack. Pours black with a thick foamy copper tan head. Aroma of smoke, dark chocolate, maple, coffee, and hints of chili and nail polish. Taste of dark chocolate, black malts, sweet maple, leather, and just a bit of chili spice. Pretty tasty!

Bottle from Vinmonopolet CC Vest enjoyed at home
Pours quite dark, opaque black in glass, huge creamy brown head. Smell of dark malts, smoke, some bacon, roast and coffee. Moderate to medium sweet, alot of smoke, roasty flavors, coffee and a chili sting, some bacon, woody tendensies, perhaps some maple syrup? Quite complex and raw, quite enjoyable. Moderate bitter, earthy hops, tail of chili. Interesting and different

Black colour, beige head. Aroma of chocolate, vanilla, bell pepper, chili, mocha coffee. Malty flavour, quite sweet, bitter roasted malts, bell pepper, light ash, slightest hint of chili. Finish cacao, light chili, ash, maple, sweet chocolate.(from 33cL bottle shared @ home)
330ml bottle. Very dark brown/black with small off white head. Aroma is coffee, chocolate and licorice. Dry mouth feel. Very carbonated. Lots of coffee. No bacon at all. Shame.
Pours black with a very thin off white head. Lovely coffee aroma with bacon. Coffee upfront and the bitterness lasts.

On tap at Cafe Sara, february 16th 2015. Dark brown body with a beige head. Aroma is smoky with mild subtle chili, roast and coffee. Taste is lightly roasted with smoke hints and dark berries. Think the whole bacon thing was just a gimmick as it didnt add anything to the taste. (After I pointed this out, [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ fried some bacon for us, giving us a chance to instantly "drybacon" the glasses ourselves, which we of course had to try after Id written my notes - Thanks a lot mate :) ). Nice mild chili and coffee finish. Overall a nice smoked beer, just dont expect anything from the bacon. Oh, and for those of you wondering how the DIY-Drybaconing went - use a small amount, eat the rest, and of course the fat WILL kill the head :)

(Buxton / Arizona Wilderness Dragon Tips) Bottle 330 ml at home, served into a snifter, ABV 8.9%
Black colour on the body, small dark brown head on top, with good density and average retention, leaving medium lacing behind.
Aroma of chocolate, cocoa, paper, something sweet that may be the maple syrup, not any smoke.
Nice taste with chocolate, roasted malts,light liquorice, very faint smoke, also faint chilis on the finish mostly, no burn.
Medium thin body, good carbonation, Id prefer it a bit thicker.
Quite good but all the extra flavours are a bit muted.

Bottle shared. Pours dark brown to almost black with deep rich mocha head, the aroma is dark roasted malts, chocolate, chili pepper and smoke. The flavor is a lot more of the aroma and then some. Love the smoky bacon and then on the very end you get the maple. Way on the very end. Overall pretty decent beer with a lot of complex flavors.
Bottle with dutchdrebus and benzai. Black color with a beige head. Smells and tastes roasty, coffee, bitter and some caramel.

Bottle @ weekly tasting shared with Dutchdrebus and Ansjelaah. Opaque black color, average sized brown head. Aroma is malts, roasted malts, strong roast, dark chocolate, light chili, lightly earthy, a hint of mocha. Tastes exactly the same: malts, roasted malts, dark chocolate, light chili which gives the beer just the spicy touch it needs, the slightest hint of smoke, lightly earthy, mocha, roast, bitter. This is a fucking lovely beer. Good body, very solid. Very impressed by this.
Bottle @ home. Black colour with a medium sized light brown head. Smells sweet, roasty, chocolate, nice. Tastes peppery, chocolate, roasty, sweet. Full body, soft carbo.
Donker bruin bijna zwart bier met een getinte kraag. Ruikt bacon, mout. Weinig aroma. Smaakt siroop, bacon, chocolade. haal er geen peper uit. Iets te hoge carbo, medium body.
Bruine bijna zwarte kleur met een goede bruune kraag. Ruikt koffie, bacon, koffie. Smaakt vol koffie, geroosterd, gerookt en vanille.
Arjan: ruikt naar bacon. Klopt. Donkerbruin, bijna zwart. Smaakt naar chocola . prima.

Tijdens het klussen aan de roze starlet. Even ene momentje voor de mannen zelf. Diep bruin met een crème kraag. De bacon is het meest op de voorgrond de peper en esdoorn komt daarna afdronk met een cacao bitter. Leuk bier

330 ml bottle. 8.9%. BB 25/09/16. Courtesy of lusikka. 
Black colour with a small tan head.
Roasted malt, vegetables, mild chili, ashy dryness and some alcohol in the aroma. The flavour is some warming chili, ash, roasted malt, bitterness, alcohol and dryness. No trace of maple or bacon. Chipotle is quite subtle.

33 cl bottle.
Pours black color with a small beige head. Chili is present first thing on the nose, dry ashy malts, roasted notes, dark chocolate and maybe coffee. Quite Porter-like palate, medium to strong carbonation, faint coffee, roasted malts and ashy notes too, chocolaty, some chili. Not really getting the bacon or maple here. Very tasty nonetheless.
4325

330 ml bottle. Pours a black colour with a small head. Aroma of heavy roastiness, chocolate and some green chili notes. Very subtle smokiness. Flavour of rich chocolate, chili, mild smokiness, ash, bread and mild sweetness. Medium bodied. Quite rich. The smoky chili notes are nice and subtle. Enjoyable.

Blackish brown colour with beige head on top. Aroma has smoke, roasted malts, coffee and licorice. Taste has smoke, licorice, coffee and roasted malts. Some chili in the end with dry after taste. Full body and medium carbonation. Didnt find any maple syrup.

Bottle from Saveur-Biere.com - Color: deep dark black beer with no carbonation and medium brown head. Smell: roasted malt and smoked notes. Caramel presence. High job on malt. Taste: nice palate, smooth and great. Good roasted malt taste with caramel. Small grassy notes. And alcohol finish. Aftertaste: roasted malt, caramel and chocolate. Alcohol finish. Very nice beer but too strong alcohol taste...

Tap @ Tallinn Craft Beer Weekend 2015


Roasty, good drinkability. Nice one from Buxton again.

Draught @ TCBW 2015 

Pours pitch black with a smooth brown head. Aroma of roasty malts, toffee, licorice, spices, wood, ash and mild chili. Taste is smooth, spicy and ashy with some roastiness, hints of chili and wood. Finish is sweetish, roasty and spicy with loads of wood, hints of chili and ash. A bit unbalanced, but tasty still.

Draught @ Tallinn Craft Beer Weekend 2015
Aroma has licorice, some cocoa tones and coffee. Flavour has cocoa, cold coffee, licorice and some ashy tones. Also some salty tones. Decent, but somewhat thin for this ABV. Gets a bit better when this warms up.
Poured deep dark brown with a dense beige head. Aroma of sweet berries, roast malt, pork and chocolate. Medium body, flavour as the aroma, bitter finish.

Bottle. Black (as anything in this lighting). Soft roasty nose, meaty, jerky smoked ham with a toffeeish.. nutty vibe. Med bodied, dry roasty slight ashy finish. Feels nice. Probably worth a lot more.-- bb

33cl bottle. Poured black with a thin brown head. Some bacon notes maybe if you are looking for it, roastedness, dark chocolate in aroma. Flavor has sweetness, roasted malt, nuts more in the long finish. Smooth. Sipper. Not for session ing.
Svart med høyt lys brunt skum. Lukter mørke bær, chili, mørk sjokolade og kaffe. Bitter mørk sjokolade og kaffe, ikke noe chilli før i ettersmak.

10.1.2015. Aroma is very roasted with coffee, slight smoke and peppery and chili spiciness, nice. Taste is a bit spicy, chili here, roasted malts, coffee stays more in back, sweetness presumaply from maple. Finish has roast, slight smoke and chili. Excellent.

Why oh why add these ridiculous ingredients to beer just awful taste , no way 
should this happen little aroma strange flavours , utter rubish
Aroma: smoke, bacon, roasty, Sea Buckthorn. Appearance: black, clear, brown foam, rocky head. Taste: medium sweetness, very bitter. Palate: medium body, oily feel, lively, bitter finish.
Aroma: smoky bacon, roasted malts, chocolate, yeast. Appearance: black liquid with brown head. Taste: heavy cloying sweetness, medium bitterness, lightly sour, tar. Palate: medium body, sticky,

Das Bier ist fast schwarz und es hat eine schöne bräunliche cremige Schaumkrone. Geruch nach Vanille, Schokolade und etwas Kaffee. Geschmack bitter röstmalzig, dann etwas süßer nach Vanille und Schokolade, sehr aromatisch und lecker!

Bottle from the Hop Hideout, Sheffield. Pours deep brown, almost black with a big tan head. Aroma of sweet chocolate. Starts off with some subtle chilli on the tongue before smokey peat notes. Im not really getting much in the way of maple or bacon aside from the smoke. This is a very tasty stout tough. Rich, creamy and full flavoured.
Bottle. Near black with tan head. Beer shtink of shmoke, some molasses and licorice. Beer taste of shmoke too. Bit sweet. One for the shmoke heads I think

Bottle. Pours a pitch black body with a large foamy light beige head. Nose is chocolate, maple syrup, caramel, mild smoky tones, coffee and hints of grains, bread dough and straw. Taste is chocolate, maple syrup, coffee, herbs, caramel, grass, mild licorice and hints of spices, red peppers and soft resinous notes. Full body, medium carbonation. A bit on the sweet side and not quite as smoky-baconed as I was looking for, but the maple syrup works well with the overall stout attributes on this one. Nice, but not outstanding.

Pours a pitch black, thick body with a scarce brown head. Nose has rich aromas of smoked malts, caramel, chokolate and even some bacon and syrup. The taste is quite intense, sweet and viscous with a roasty bitterness kicking in after a while that really sticks on the palate with a hint of a burn on the side. Carbonation is on the low side, the mouthfeel is very rich and almost but not quite cloying. This is very good, nicely balanced and interesting with loads of nuances and layers to be discovered.

bottle at home from cotteridgeDark and murky brown with fluffy tan-grey head. Rich smokey, slighly metallic nose, full bodied with zippy carbonation, coffee, chocolate and beechsmoke with just a hint of heat in finish. Decenet big stout, well executed.

Bottle labelled 8.9%, pours espresso black with a coarse tan head, nose is lightly smoky with hints of charcoal, treacle and liquorice, and just a touch of bacon. Creamy-dry body quickly turns roasty and warming, with a light chilli bite, toasted treacle, salt liquorice, dry umami and a firm burnt-bitter finish.

6th Feb 2015. Large sample from a 33cl bottle: there were a few bottles of this brew to be shared in De Bierboom (Brugge) during a Belgian Beer Board organised bottle exchange. Black pour with a good tanned topping. I expected more smoke and bacon notes in both the aromas and taste, not so. Aroma was roasted malts with caramel and coffee to the fore, smoky bacon notes had to be searched for. The taste was fairly sweet, again caramel and coffee leading the way, some bitterness but very little heat or smokiness for me until the finish.

Bottle. Pours a black body producing a mediumsized, thick and creamy looking, dark-tanned head. Aroma is rich coffee, burnt grains, hints of chili and smoke. Taste is roasty, light sweet, bitter coffee and burnt grains. Slight chili and alcohol warmth. Thick mouthfeel, full body and avg co2 levels.

Bottle from Vinmonopolet, Kvadrat. Pours pitch black with a huge frothy tanned head. Lovely aroma, deep chocolate with coffee notes. Taste is malty, hard chocolate, no sweetness at all,clean cocoa beans and a distinct chili burn at the finish. Smooth creamy mouthfeel. Very enjoyable and moreish.
0.33 flaske kull svart med brunt flott skum. Smak av malt litt chili. Aroma malt. Søt.

DWF; Bottle 11,2 fl oz. Pours black with a large, creamy, lasting and lacing tan head. Aroma is surprising moderate, roasted malt, caramel, coffee, smoked bacon and spice. Taste is heavy sweet, light bitter and umami with a lasting roasted, perfect chilli burn finish. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft.

UPDATED: FEB 20, 2015 
Lukt: Sjokolade, vanilje, lakris, bek og røyk.
Utseende: Dyp sort.
Skum/kullsyre: Tynt dekkende brunt skum.
Smak: Sjokolade, sirup, vanilje og lakris.

Yet another amazing brew from an amazing brewery. Rich chocolate, doesnt need 10%+ alcohol. Full of modern pine and spruce hops, plus a rich, almost fatty chocolate and smoky body. Absolutely not overdone, just luscious goodness. Soft carbonation. Superb beer. (33cl bottle from Saveur Bière)
How: Bottle Appearance: dark brown, small tan head. Aroma; chocolate, roast, spice, coffee Palate: medium to full body, soft carbonation.

Dark brown beer, beige head. Smokey nose, chili, roast, chocolate. Flavor is roasty bitterness, smoke, dry notes, caramel, some chili heat which builds up after a few sips. Wheres the maple? Not exactly balanced, but interesting. Shared by martjoobolut, thanks!

0,33L bottle (from Drink Shop, Tallinn). Pours dark brown with light brown head. The head doesnt stay. Aroma is chili, roast, coffee, smoke. Flavor is sweet, roast, dark chocolate, chili, coffee, ash. Alcohol is well covered. Finish is intense dry-roast bitter. Overall: very good brew.

Draught at Olhops Craft Beer House, Valencia. Pitch black - offwhite head.high malty. Spicy chili notes. Nice smokey. Light bacon. Acid freshness. Fresh coffee notes. Ok mild bitterness. High drinkability.

UPDATED: FEB 6, 2015 Bottle from Rehills, Newcastle. Black-brown coloured with chocolate and liquorice flavours, smoked notes and a bitter roasted finish. Superb, but the bacon adds absolutley nothing to the flavour hence the low score.

Bottle; Ale House bottle share; thanks to Steve from Beer oClock Show. Opaque black. Smokey marzen malts. Treacle. Leather. Grains. Cocoa nibs. Taste is blackcurrants, alcohol, chili hotness, cold coffee. Charcoal. Oakchips. Complex. Interesting. I expected a bit more. There was some maple syrup there.

Black, strong beige head. Maple, slight smoke and roasty cocoa on the nose. Roasty, somwhat bitter, notes of bacon and maple, finishes with a fun chilli heat. Very good, if you like nice things - like bacon and maple syrup.
Bottle from Cotteridge Wines; dark brown almost black pour with a big frothy tan head, smoke and roast malt aroma, taste has maple syrup, a hint of chilli spice heat, chocolate, sweet and pleasant.

(Draught at Man in the Moon, Stockholm, 8 Nov 2014) Black colour with dense, beige head. Malty, roasted nose with notes of dark chocolate, coffee and a touch of smoke. Malty, roasted taste with dark chocolate, black coffee, chilli, a touch of smoke, treacle and a generous roasted bitterness in the finish. Almost full body, with a certain sweetness. This sounds like a weird idea for a beer, but it actually works well. Complex, but still well balanced and really tasty. Very nice.

Pours black with loose, beige head. Aromas of char, and would you guess it, maple-smoked bacon and a faint chili background. Taste is semi-sweet chocolate up front, with some char and very slight chili heat coming through. Finish is bacon, more roasty, coffee flavors and warming alcohol. Viscous body with low carb.

33cl bottle at Drink bar, Tallinn. Pours pretty close to pitch black with a beige head. Aroma of roasted malt with dark, bitter chocolate, hints of dark fruits, dark bread and some lightly spicy notes. Medium sweet with nice roasty flavours, a balanced bitterness and a mild chili burn in the finish. Dont get much of the bacon, thou, but possibly hints of smoke. Balanced, flavourful and quite delicious. Nice winter warmer.

Bottle. Near black with a beige head. Aromas are nutty, earthy coffee with burnt toast. Blackberries with floral notes and maple syrup. Smoky with hints of meatiness. Coal with pepper and dark toffee. Flavours are sweet cola with chocolate and dark cherry. Toffee with blackberries and bready yeast. Coffee with spicy alcohol and burnt toast. Hints of metal with an earthy finish. Very good.

Bottle. Pours a dark brown, black with a good, dark latte-colored head. Aroma is chocolate, roast, some syrup, some smoke, light, crisp bacon. Taste is roast, chocolate, some smoke, roast, light pepper, crisp bacon, light wooden tones. Fairly full, medium carbonation, slight burn in the back of the throat.

The Bottle Shop. Black beer lasting tan head. Very pleasant. Good dry strong chocolate stout. Touch of chilli on the finish some maple syrup sweetness in the middle. Merest touch of bacon on the aroma. This is enjoyable.

330ml bottle. Pitch black color. Medium size, yellow head, stays. Peppery, roast, bit papery notes in aroma. Nice and mild aroma. Roast, chilly, malts, sweet, toffee in taste. Weird syrupy mouthfeel. Rough roast in aftertaste. Nice one!
330ml bottle. Black colour with small, creamy, half-way lasting and lacing, tan head. Roasty dark malty aroma, minimally smoky and dirty. Taste of burnt oxtail soup. Inharmonious.

330ml bottle from Eebria. Pours black with a 1 inch beige head. Aromas of coffee and milk chocolate, smokiness too. Taste is quite sweet, smoky, meaty, liquorice, dark chocolate. Smooth, rich texture. Sweet finish with a tingle of heat.

Bottle from Drygate. Poured thick and black with a foamy beige head. Coffee on the nose, taste is dominated by coffee and bitter chocolate with some chilli heat in the aftertaste. Didnt get any hints of maple or bacon, although it was certainly smoky. Good

Bottle: Thanks GlasgowTAD: Served at 14 degrees Cesius in a Chouffe glass:
Medium sized vast creamy beige head on top of a black beer.
Aromas of malt roast, some hair, chocolate, mocha, light smoke, light tobacco, meat, some caramel and manure.
Flavours of cacoa, peppers, roasted malts, chocolate, coffee, hay roast, some yeast, litle sharp tone, some yeast and caramel.
Aftertaste is bitter, coffee, malt roast and some dusty pepper tones.
Low carbo, creamy mouthfeel, body is between medium and full.
user_location: Best of E-Town mit 2 Brauhausen, NETHERLANDS

text: Bottle from BeerRitz. Pours dark, dark brown with a chocolate brown head. Looks syrupy and rich. Love the way it smells. Not getting much bacon but i definitely like the roastiness and smoke that comes through. Chipotle is there too. Thick mouthfeel. Flavour is sweet with rich maple but is matched by a surprisingly upfont bitterness. Liking the chipotle with its smoke and that vegetal chilli note with a wee peppery burn. Coffee. No real pork products shining through which does disappoint a little but otherwise.....awesome!

UPDATED: MAY 26, 2015 330 ml bottle (Koht, Tallinn) (7:4:7:4:13=3.5)
Oooh, I like the roasty aroma. Anna gets the coffee here, I dont convincingly. Dark, small tan head. Full palate, but quite simple as a stout. Nice roast, sweetish and burnt coffee. Palate a bit fizzy (force carbonation? sucks!). Finish is the best bit, a really deep rich coffee that completely fills the mouth. However, I didnt need to drink a beer for that, I can go to my local cafe, and pay 1/3 of the price for a delicious coffee. Clearly beer for fetishists. 
Anna: "The aromas darker than beige"
Rerate: Tap (TCBW15) (7:4:6:4:13=3.4)
Lovely coffee aroma. Kinda bland roasty palate. Nothing past the dark malts in the taste, if anything Im almost bored compared to the aroma, which was great. Pretty solid stout though. Chilli low to non-existent, as the roast is so full.

UPDATED: JAN 11, 2015 زجاجة انقسام في LKS "بيرز في لندن" Tasting، عالية، بفضل دا النقابة في 12/10/14.
الضوء الأسود مع غطاء كريم تان أن يحتفظ بشكل جي.

Rating experiment #7. Not sure this works. Revert to type ...

Bottle split at LKS Beers of London Tasting, high up, thanks to the the Syndicata, 10/12/14.
Light black with a decent tan covering that retains well.
Nose is chocolate, spice, coffee notes, light smoke, rich malt dose.
Taste comprises mineral notes, coffee grinds, dark malt, spice, cocoa powder, sweet licks, light smoked bacon evident.
Medium + body, fine carbonation, semi drying close.
Solid impy.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Pours black with a huge, frothy brown head that quickly dies off to a brown pool of bubbles. Aroma is smoked bacon, chocolate and figs. Taste is chocolate, roast malts and smoked bacon followed by sweet molasses.

Bottle @ De Tolly Joogipood. Pours black with brown head. Aroma of roasted malts, coffee, dark chocolate, smoke bitter.Taste is smoked malts, medium bitter, coffee, there is a hints of bacon(or lard). Full body. Soft carbonation
Bottle at home. Pours black, nose is smoky chipotle, a little bacon, chocolate, maple, taste is dry roast, chocolate, light smoke, light burn, bacon.

330ml bottle, pours black with a tan head. Aroma is sweet caramel malt, burnt, roasty chocolate, cocoa nibs, smokiness, light smoked bacon, lots of flavours, a little messy, body is medium, texture is oliy, carbonation is soft to flat. Finish is sweet with bitter hop challengiing and some alcohol burn.

Bottle from beer central, sheffield. Black with a tan head. Aroma of smoked meat and roasted coffee. Taste is syrupy sweet, hence the maple syrup I suppose. Lovely smoky bitterness too. Full oily body and medium carbonation. Nice but sickly, could not have more than one.

330ml bottle BB Sep 2016. Black, massive foamy tan head, light lacing. Aroma is yeasty, coffee-ish, possibly some smokey bacon but maybe Im searching for it. Body is medium, slightly foamy, very low carbonation. Taste is malty, ashy, chipotle heat, drying, breathy smoke, semisweet. Decent.

Bottle from Eebria, consumed at Foxhills campsite, Weybourne, Norfolk, Friday 26th December 2014   Mahogany with reddy glints and a large sticky tan head that swiftly departs. A little warmth from the chipolte, the bacon is much less noticeable. Some sweet rich liquorice a bitter sweeness, like mollasses and a little heat from the alcohol. Very good but even so not as good as I was expecting.  A6 A4 T7 P4 Ov13 3.4

Bottle from the Bottle Bank. 
Appearance - opaque black with a lovely fawn headpeas. ose - cocoa but then green vegetables come forth. Green pepper and even green pea
Taste - burnt coffee with warming Chipotle edge.
Palate - medium bodied with a creamy texture and a long dry finish. 
Overall - good but more interesting than good.

From brewers droop, Bristol 
330 ml bottle [BBE:25/09/16] 
Blood alc: 41 mg/100ml 

Pours very dark brown to black with a lovely big pouffey cappuccino/latté head. Smells like coffee primarily with a damped boozy note and a rich tang, possibly coming from the dry bacon salt. 
The taste experience is layered but fast with coffee bitterness being almost exclusively present at first, leading into a bacony salt sensation and leaving the saltiness as it fades in tandem with the bacon flavour. Theres some deep roasty notes going on somewhere in the middle. 
Honestly this is a great beer and Im excited to follow Buxtons story as theyve got some great ideas and they really know how to pull off bizarre flavours but this one was a bit too burnt and roasty for me, making it quite hard to fully appreciate the more unique flavours which I think are going on in here. I couldnt detect any spice unfortunately and Im not a fan of coffee in beers as I think the green (as I perceive it) bitterness it imparts is usually quite unpleasant. Im not certain that coffee was used from information I have but Im pretty sure based on the flavour. I like a good gimmick, and this definitely qualifies - but Ill always compare their beer to the wonder which was yellow belly - a stout which tasted miraculously just like peanut butter (except not having the effect of making me gag), and that is a heavy bar to raise...
 
=78%
Bottle from Cornelius. Black, lovely beige creamy head. Woody and meaty nose with chocolate base. Lightly bitter initial taste with milk chocolate and roast malts. Nice.

Bottle. Nose is smoke, vanilla, bacon crisps, latte, chipotle, bbq meat. Taste is chipotle, leading to smoke, vanilla, sweet maple, wood, chocolate, lots of salt, leading to coffee and a light bacon with a lot of chilli in the finish. Mouthfeel is good.

I am not often keen on this kind of experimentation but I really enjoyed this.

UPDATED: DEC 23, 2016 Bottle at home 17/12/2014... Dark black.. Thin tan lacing... Soft chocolate... Dry charcoal nose... Soft chocolate roast... Dark malts... Light bitter chocolate roast... Dry roast.. Light funk... Bitter roast... Light charcoal.. Soft milky coffee lactose... 3.i

Bottle at home 23/12/16. ... Same batch... Dark black... Massive tan bubble foam head... Dark chocolate roast... Heavy sweet chocolate.. Milky chocolate roast... Dry chocolate roast... Light bitter malts.. Quite a salty bitter finish...  Its nice but something i think the salty finish just doesnt work for me.  Stick at 3.8
330ml bottle at 8.9%. Pours very dark brown with a large head. Aroma is smoky coffee with a little chilli warmth. Taste is watery coffee with some smoke and chilli warmth on the finish.

10th December 2014Tasting at Leightons Flat. Thanks to Leighton for procuring. Opaque dark brown beer, big pale tan head. Mellow dark malts on the nose and a whisper of bacon! Palate is airy and semi dry with mild fine carbonation. Airy dark malts, little cream. Savoury notes mix with dark fruits, traces of bacon follow the nose. Turns bitterish before an airy finish. Bitter linger. Interesting but could not drink a lot of this.

Bottle big thanks to Leighton. It pours near opaque black with a thick tan head. The nose is toasty, earthy, charred wood, toast, sweet maple, smoke and bacon. The taste is bitter, toasty, earth, charred stuff, umami, treacle, candy, salty bacon, cured meats, maple, light spice and orange peel. Medium+ body and fine carbonation. A touch salty perhaps, but great fun! Weird and unique.

Draught at Man In The Moon, Stockholm. Opaque black beer with a decent beige head. Chili and bacon aroma, woody, some chocolate. Bacon and chili flavor. Not your average beer... A bit too weird for me.

Bottle shared in London. Pours black-brown with a dense, foamy mocha head. Lots of baking cocoa on the nose, burnt wood, earth, cedar. Medium sweet flavor with creamy chocolate, dry smoke, burnt toast, earth, raisins. Medium to full bodied with average, massaging carbonation. Lightly warming on the finish, more bittersweet cocoa, more dried fruits. Solid.

Bottle shared at Leightons pre Christmas tasting. Thanks to Leighton, Aroma is Charcuterie, salty meat, bacon, dirty malt, Dark brown / caramel coloured pour with a cream tan head. Flavour Is composed of nutty, praline, choc, dark caramel malts some salty charcuterie. Palate is medium full, praline, highish carbonation. Very salty in the finish. Interesting beer.
@ Man in the Moon, Stockholm 14-11-8: riktig träig och rökig doft och smak med tydlig spår av aska.

Tap. Port Street Beer House, Manchester. Just about black. Thinnest halo of tan, for a head. Soft smoke. Wet leather. Soft, treacly, dark fruit. A bit reserved, really. Taste is when this comes alive. Its smoky sweet. Roast dry, turning savoury, and light bitter. Add to that a subtle chilli burn. Lovely stuff. I suspect the subdued aroma is due, in part, to the fact its a bit cold.

How: Draught.
Where: Man in the Moon, Stockholm.
Appearance: Black colour with a beige head.
Aroma: Bacon, smoked malt, chilli, caramel.
Body: Full body, low to medium carbonation.
Flavour: Bacon, caramel, malt, chilli, smoke.

On tap at Man in the Moon. 

Black with a small tan head. Sweet with roasted malt, light smoke, chocolate and some light notes of chili. Full body and with a long finish.

Keg at Man in the Moon, Stockholm.  Black, beige head. Aroma of sugared bacon. Very sweet with full body and rounded mouthfeel. Milk chocolate, caramel and bacon. Low bitterness in a finish with minimal chili heat.

Keg @ Man in The Moon. Pitch black with small tan head. Aroma of burnt wood and roasted malt. Taste of some smoked chili / bacon with woody notes, probably from the chipotle. Not very much heat, but the chipotle taste really shines through with a dry somewhat spicy finish.

Keg at IMBC 14. Fully black with a short brown head. Aroma is brimming with roasted malt and chipotle heat. Taste has plenty more chili heat but much harder to find any trace of maple or bacon. Big body for just 8%. The base stout seems solid but not all of the adjuncts found room to manoeuvre.
